radiographic_examinations.findings: A 13-mm peripheral hypodensity in segment VII of the liver, a second 6-mm hypodensity in the right lobe of liver, mild periportal edema, 6-mm hypodensity in the left kidney, 11-mm dilated tubular structure in the right lower quadrant with a 4-mm stone concerning for an appendicolith within an inflamed appendix. No pleural or pericardial effusion, gallbladder unremarkable, stomach, small bowel, and colon within normal limits.
